CatDescriptText: Mrs. M. White, housewife, 223 S. Euclid Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 18, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think parents should permit teen-agers to smoke, particularly those who still are in school?" answer reads: "I don't think that it is good for the children, therefore parents should not allow teenagers to smoke. It is not good for the latter's health."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. M. White wearing hat, eyeglasses, and light colored coat with dark collar, standing on sidewalk with Weinsteins Sandwich Shop Liquor sign in background
